# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_internal/commands/configuration.py
@source-hash: 9fdf1e9f0a7acb46
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:59:21Z

## Purpose
Implementation of pip's `config` command for managing pip configuration files (local and global settings). Provides subcommands to list, edit, get, set, unset, and debug configuration values across different configuration scopes.

## Key Components

**ConfigurationCommand (L22-280)**
- Main command class inheriting from `Command`
- Manages pip configuration through subcommands: list, edit, get, set, unset, debug
- Handles three configuration file scopes: user (`--user`), global (`--global`), site (`--site`)
- Uses dot-separated keys like `global.index-url` or `download.timeout`

**Core Methods:**
- `add_options()` (L58-94): Defines CLI options for editor selection and file scope
- `run()` (L96-139): Main entry point, dispatches to appropriate handler based on subcommand
- `_determine_file()` (L141-169): Resolves which configuration file to operate on based on CLI flags
- `_get_n_args()` (L247-259): Validates argument count for subcommands

**Subcommand Handlers:**
- `list_values()` (L171-175): Lists all active configuration key-value pairs
- `get_name()` (L177-181): Retrieves value for specific configuration key
- `set_name_value()` (L183-187): Sets configuration key to specified value
- `unset_name()` (L189-193): Removes configuration key
- `list_config_values()` (L195-209): Debug output showing all config files and their contents
- `open_in_editor()` (L225-245): Opens configuration file in external editor

**Utility Methods:**
- `print_config_file_values()` (L211-215): Prints key-value pairs from specific config variant
- `print_env_var_values()` (L217-223): Shows configuration from environment variables
- `_save_configuration()` (L261-270): Persists configuration changes to disk
- `_determine_editor()` (L272-280): Resolves editor from options or environment variables

## Dependencies
- `pip._internal.configuration.Configuration`: Core configuration management
- `pip._internal.cli.base_command.Command`: Base command class
- Standard library: `subprocess` for editor invocation, `os` for environment/file operations

## Configuration Logic
File precedence: Explicit flags override defaults. Without flags, uses site config if exists, otherwise user config. For read-only operations (list, debug), loads all available configs. For modifications, requires single target file.

## Error Handling
All subcommand errors bubble up to `run()` method which logs and returns ERROR status code. Editor subprocess failures and configuration save errors are wrapped in PipError exceptions.
